parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Orders the unit(s) to watch the given position or target (via the radio). Use [[objNull]] as the target to order a unit to stop watching a position/target. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> units [[commandWatch]] position </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> units: [[Object]] or [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] - format [[Position]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> units [[commandWatch]] target </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> units: [[Object]] or [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> target: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldierOne [[commandWatch]] [[markerPos]] "MarkerMoveOne";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[s1, s2] [[commandWatch]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> This command is only effective when used on local units. When used on a remote unit, this command will create radio dialogue on the machine the unit is local to, but the unit will not watch the target object/position. </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[doWatch]], [[lookAt]], [[glanceAt]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>
